paper.title: Computer-Aided Verification of Software Process Model Properties
paper.venue: Conference on Advanced Information Systems Engineering
paper.abstract: In this paper we introduce an approach to computer-aided verification of software process model properties. This approach uses a net-based software process modeling language called FUNSOFT nets. FUNSOFT nets are highlevel Petri nets which are adapted to the application domain of software process modeling. In this paper we focus on the verification of static and dynamic software process model properties. We define some software process model properties and introduce the notion of coverability trees for FUNSOFT nets. Moreover, we discuss how a verification component for FUNSOFT nets is integrated into the software process management environment MELMAC.
